title: Upcoming Webinar: View Real-Time Snow Depth Data in the Snow Groomer & the Office
text:
Rugged handheld computer manufacturer, Juniper Systems, is holding a free webinar on September 24th, where they will demonstrate how to use their new SnowGage system to easily collect real-time snow depth data and improve ski resort operations.
Logan, Utah
Rugged handheld computer manufacturer, Juniper Systems, is holding a free webinar on September 24th, where they will demonstrate how to use their new SnowGage system to easily collect real-time snow depth data and improve ski resort operations.
Juniper Systems’ SnowGage system works by transmitting real-time snow depth data directly from the sensor to the snow groomer operator, as well as to operations managers in the office, allowing for faster and more informed decision making.
In the webinar, Juniper Systems will demonstrate how to:
 View accurate, real-time snow depth data from the snow groomer and in the office Utilize practical snow depth maps to: Improve grooming decisions Target snowmaking in areas that need it most Gain visibility on trail conditions Improve productivity and efficiency of resort operations
“SnowGage is an affordable system that provides immediate visibility into snow conditions throughout the resort,” said Trevor Brown, Juniper Systems’ Natural Resources Market Manager. “Using SnowGage, snow groomer operators can view real-time snow depths, which allows grooming decisions to be made on the slope. Simultaneously, snow depths are mapped with GPS and sent automatically to a resort’s unique website, enabling mountain operations and snow-making staff to focus resources on the areas that need it most, thereby cutting down on time and costs.”
Webinar seats are limited. To register for the webinar, click here: http://bit.ly/1ieihXn .
To learn more about Juniper Systems’ SnowGage system, click here: http://bit.ly/1ieOhe1 .
About Juniper Systems:
Based out of Logan, UT, USA and Birmingham, UK, Juniper Systems designs and manufactures rugged handheld computers and provides field data collection solutions for use in extreme environments. Since 1993, Juniper Systems has provided innovative mobile technology to natural resources, utilities and public services, geomatics, agriculture, industrial, and military markets. For more information on Juniper Systems products, please visit http://www.junipersys.com .
